stories.title: Stop Using Microservices. Build Monoliths Instead
Is my Facebook activity fcking my finances?

stories.text:
I'm a developer and I recently broke my wrist. I now face weeks of typing with a single hand.

You'd assume removing one hand would mean you'd type at half the rate, but I'm finding I'm typing at maybe a quarter as quickly or slower.

I'm dreading this coming period of my life, but it could be worse, so I'm staying positive. At any rate, I'd appreciate help.

Has anyone here gone through a similar experience? Do you have advice / tips / received wisdom that I might benefit from?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to work effectively at a typing-based job after breaking my wrist?
It's Perfectly Fine to Shut Up

stories.text:
I definitely think less of Github for this.

Multiple HN users confirm issue: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=28874751

Status page denying anything happened: https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/81lpnf07bm1q
stories.title: GitHub was down, status wasn't updated, report thread was flagged

stories.text:
I maintain an npm module that enables react applications to authenticate against generic IDPs using pkce. I wrote this to auth against Cognito back when the Amplify packages were adding 1.7MB to the bundle size.

I just noticed that somebody copied the files from my repo into a new repo, destroying all the git history. This person then added a LICENSE file claiming copyright over all the files.

My repo lacks a LICENSE file but it is marked as MIT on the GitHub project page. I would assume the person can't claim license over all of my work like that. For jurisdictions: the person appears to live in Norway while I live in New Zealand.

I sent them an email and haven't heard back yet. What should I do?
stories.title: Ask HN: What to do when somebody “steals” your MIT licensed code?
